newsitem.title: CANADA: Soros rumored to be buying Canadian dlr - dealers.
newsitem.headline: Soros rumored to be buying Canadian dlr - dealers.

text.p: Rumors have been circulating that financier George Soros has been buying Canadian dollars, financial markets sources said on Friday.
"There's been rumors that he's been around for two days really," said one Toronto-based currency dealer. "I can't confirm anything."
A Toronto-based bond portfolio manager also reported hearing rumors this morning.
"There's apparently some rumor that Soros is buying the Canadian dollar," said the portfolio manager. A third dealer said he hadn't heard the rumor.
A spokesman for Soros declined to comment on the rumors.
"It's the policy of Soros and management not to comment on rumor. We would not disclose our stance," said Soros spokesman Shawn Pattison.

The Canadian dollar traded stronger at midday at C$1.3548 (US$0.7381) from its open at C$1.3580 (US$0.7363). Dealers cited strong broad-based foreign buying of Canadian dollars, as well as some corporate interest.
